intro: Erysimum hezarense, commonly known as the Hesperian wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features basal and cauline leaves that are lanceolate to elliptic in shape. Its flowers are yellow to orange in color, with four petals arranged in a cross shape, typical of the Brassicaceae family. Erysimum hezarense thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
